64,software,/en/job/senior-software-engineer-.net-core-9390409,9390409,Senior Software Engineer (.Net Core),False,False,5000,7500,SGD,Beta Werkz Pte Ltd,17-Mar-22,False,,1 day,201733610M,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

Beta Werkz began in 2017 as a startup ourselves in Learning Management System. Having been through the journey helped us understand the challenges that startup founders face at each step of the way. We derive great satisfaction from bringing ideas to fruition. It is equally important to us that this is done to high standards, as we value the trust from our partners. We are committed to be responsive and available to meet our partners’ needs. That is why despite higher cost, we have chosen to base our team in Singapore. Today, at our own workspace in Tai Seng, we have a built a motivated team of IT professionals who are eager to meet new challenges.

","

Job Functions

  • Responsible for company's Backend web applications
  • Build and maintain highly reliable, efficient and scalable micro services
  • Build/Maintain applications with .Net Core 2.x and above
  • Build/Maintain real time application such as SignalR
  • Identify/Trace bottlenecks and bugs, and plan with Solution Architect solutions to these problems
  • Identify, diagnose, track, and resolve bugs and document bug cycle
  • Participate in project development lifecycle such as requirements gathering, UI/UX design and testing
  • Taking initiative and collaborate with Frontend/Design team to discuss about ideas and technical feasibility
  • Implement proxy services to third party headless endpoint into useful endpoints for Frontend integration
  • Maintain good documentation, workflow and observance to best practices
  • Constantly on a lookout of the latest Web / API technology and do research and prototyping on such new technologies or trends
  • Highly self-motivated to participate and coordinate planning sessions to provide timeline estimation for business prospect
  • Always keeping up with technical standards and trends to maintain relevant in the current industry

Requirements

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related discipline with at least 5 years of web Backend development experiences
  • At least 3 years of experience developing web Backend applications or API services using ASP.Net or .Net Core framework
  • Track record of at least 2 full complex backend project cycles
  • Solid understanding in Monolithic and Event driven architectures
  • Experience with MVC, RESTful and Real Time architectures is a must
  • Solid understanding of ORM, Entity Framework is a must
  • Experience in using caching database such as Redis is a must
  • Experience in using RDS database such as Oracle, MSSQL or Postgres is a must
  • A strong coder, with a solid understanding of data structure and algorithm
  • Experience with RESTful API integration
  • Have knowledge in code/deployment management tools such as Jenkins, GitHub, GitLab, Jira, Trello
  • Experience in Frontend technologies such as ReactJS, NextJs, AngularJS or similar will be a super plus
  • Experience in serverless Architecture
  • Experience displaying pointers in cloud services such AWS, Azure, GCP and ability setting up CI/CD & DevOPS will be on the higher range of this position
  • Agile methodology is an everyday thing
  • Mandarin will be require to liase for our China projects

Other Requirements

  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Highly self-motivated and ability to work as a team and independently
  • Highly initiative in identifying issues and share it with the team
  • Always willing to share experiences and know-hows to he team
  • Have the eye for details

67,software,/en/job/software-engineer-9357150,9357150,Software Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,Diebold Nixdorf Singapore Pte. Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,24 days,198203384D,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div>

Diebold Nixdorf is a world leader in enabling connected commerce for millions of consumers each day across the financial and retail industries. Its software-defined solutions bridge the physical and digital worlds of cash and consumer transactions conveniently, securely and efficiently. As an innovation partner for nearly all of the world’s top 100 financial institutions and a majority of the top 25 global retailers, Diebold Nixdorf delivers unparalleled services and technology that are essential to evolve in an ‘always on’ and changing consumer landscape.

Diebold Nixdorf has a presence in more than 130 countries with approximately 25,000 employees worldwide. The organization maintains corporate offices in North Canton, Ohio, USA and Paderborn, Germany. Visit www.DieboldNixdorf.com for more information.

","
Position Overview
The System Integrator or Software Engineer will be part of an international delivery team whose main tasks will be to develop, customize, implement and integrate the payment application into the designed customer environment.
This includes all aspect of a software engineering practice, working within a project team, end to end.
As most of the international team members are located not in Singapore, all on-site DevOps activities are within the scope of this role.
The candidate will possess in-depth technical Java skills and preferably experienced in the Banking payment industry especially in Payments area.
Responsibilities
• Comprehensive and technical understanding of the project scope.
• Ensure understanding of customer requirements and the ability to deliver scheduled deliverables with quality.
• Carry out unit testing and perform code review with peers.
• Perform onsite integration tests with QA and track/fix issues to resolution.
• Where required provide estimates to architect for review and agreement.
• Ability to work independently with minimal guidance in a global team environment.
• Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
• Write technical documentation
• Work closely with Solution Architect and Project Manager.
Qualifications
• Education: University Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
• Work experience in a comparable position for at least 5 years.
• Experience in working in a global team environment
• Highly analytical and able to design and implement reliable, scalable and highly performing solutions.
• Experience with the full software development life cycle using traditional and/or Agile methodologies.
• A pragmatic, but innovative problem solver
• Experienced in enterprise  architecture, Java ( EJB), SOA, Microservices, containerization, API and modern integration methods ( e.g. Kafka)
• Experienced with SQL ( e.g. Oracle, MS SQL, Postgres)
• Fluent English skills
• Willingness to travel at short notice and spend longer periods abroad.
• Knowledge of the methodology & tools of agile software development - preferably SCRUM, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Nexus, SonarQube, etc.
• Advantage to possess experience of card( debit and credit) and/or cardless payment projects and, of various flavors of  ISO8583 implementations as well as keeping up-to-date with Payment standard.

Preferred Qualifications
• Good knowledge of the scope of services of the Diebold Nixdorf software portfolio for banks – especially in the domain of payments applications. Relevant Banking experience will be an advantage.
• Knowledge of cloud technologies, such as virtualization, containers, high availability, data security, as well as the design and operation of cloud environments
• Working knowledge of DevOps, CI/CD and automation technologies.
• Certification in Cloud ( e.g. AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner) would be advantageous.
• Experience with Shared ( ATM or POS) networks as well as the global card schemes.
• Exposure to other payment standards for messaging ( e.g. ISO20022)
• Experienced with card management system ( card issuing ) and fraud detection.

Why should you join Diebold Nixdorf?
Brightest minds + technology and innovation + business transformation. The people of Diebold Nixdorf are 23,000+ teammates of diverse talents and expertise in more than 130 countries, harnessing future technologies to deliver personalized, secure consumer experiences that connect people to commerce. Our culture is fueled by our values of collaboration, decisiveness, urgency, willingness to change, and accountability.
–Diebold Nixdorf is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
** To all recruitment agencies: Diebold Nixdorf does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Diebold Nixdorf employees or any other organization location. Diebold Nixdorf is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes**

column1: 71,software,/en/job/junior-software-engineer-darwin-9360630,9360630,"Junior Software Engineer, DARWIN",False,False,,,SGD,Marsh McLennan,11 hours ago,False,,,197200396D,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s 81,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries.  With annual revenue over $19 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. ","
CAREER DEVELOPMENT

We attract and retain candidates that enjoy working on complex Software Engineering challenges, seeing their work used by many clients, and being part of our Product development over the longer term.
We offer a range of techniques to help our engineers grow and develop:
Our Darwin Growth Framework helps individuals identify strengths and areas of development independent of the role they are performing.
Our on-demand technical training platform is brilliant for individual learning needs
Our culture of growth and learning is integrated into how we work. A code-review for example would be a positive opportunity to question, discuss and reflect on appropriate solutions
We have many examples of people joining at Grad level and progressing right through to Enterprise Architecture.  Alternative paths include, Delivery, Release, Quality Assurance (Engineer in Test), Product management and much, much more.
In order to support our team and strengthen the growth of our global business, we are looking for a:
Junior Software Engineer, DARWIN
Join us on our journey and take the next step in your career.
What can you expect?
Every member of the Software Engineering department is responsible for:
The availability, security, scalability of our Darwin platform.
Delivering our product roadmap.
Planning for the future.
Generating enthusiasm and a sense of both technical and product pride.
What is in it for you?
An opportunity to work in a fast growing, innovative company with lots of room for progression
A fail-friendly environment that encourages learning and initiative
Comprehensive employee benefits and insurance coverage
Flexible working environment
Work as part of a geographically distributed team, with colleagues in the UK and Romania
Employee Engagement events
We will count on you to:
Be passionate and enthusiastic about software engineering.
Track the progress that you are making towards the wider goals of your team, and transparently communicate that progress to your team and Technical Lead.
Keep to the processes, standards and designs your team has agreed.
Ensure you and others continuously improve, by proposing and implementing new processes, designs and engineering practices that make the team more effective.
Contribute to the definition of product features, getting involved in workshops with other engineering teams and Product Management.
Take responsibility for supporting your changes all the way through to proving that they work well – and continue to work well – in production.
What you need to have:
Degree in Computing or related subject

column2:
Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s 81,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries.  With annual revenue over $19 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. ","
CAREER DEVELOPMENT

We attract and retain candidates that enjoy working on complex Software Engineering challenges, seeing their work used by many clients, and being part of our Product development over the longer term.
We offer a range of techniques to help our engineers grow and develop:
Our Darwin Growth Framework helps individuals identify strengths and areas of development independent of the role they are performing.
Our on-demand technical training platform is brilliant for individual learning needs
Our culture of growth and learning is integrated into how we work. A code-review for example would be a positive opportunity to question, discuss and reflect on appropriate solutions
We have many examples of people joining at Grad level and progressing right through to Enterprise Architecture.  Alternative paths include, Delivery, Release, Quality Assurance (Engineer in Test), Product management and much, much more.
In order to support our team and strengthen the growth of our global business, we are looking for a:
Junior Software Engineer, DARWIN
Join us on our journey and take the next step in your career.
What can you expect?
Every member of the Software Engineering department is responsible for:
The availability, security, scalability of our Darwin platform.
Delivering our product roadmap.
Planning for the future.
Generating enthusiasm and a sense of both technical and product pride.
What is in it for you?
An opportunity to work in a fast growing, innovative company with lots of room for progression
A fail-friendly environment that encourages learning and initiative
Comprehensive employee benefits and insurance coverage
Flexible working environment
Work as part of a geographically distributed team, with colleagues in the UK and Romania
Employee Engagement events
We will count on you to:
Be passionate and enthusiastic about software engineering.
Track the progress that you are making towards the wider goals of your team, and transparently communicate that progress to your team and Technical Lead.
Keep to the processes, standards and designs your team has agreed.
Ensure you and others continuously improve, by proposing and implementing new processes, designs and engineering practices that make the team more effective.
Contribute to the definition of product features, getting involved in workshops with other engineering teams and Product Management.
Take responsibility for supporting your changes all the way through to proving that they work well – and continue to work well – in production.
What you need to have:
Degree in Computing or related subject
1-2 years of real world programming experience in multi-tier, full-stack web applications
A good understanding of an object-oriented programming language, Agile development methodologies and continuous delivery
Strong technical/programming ability, ideally familiar with Microsoft technologies.
Experience in development using C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, WCF, MVC, Angular
Enthusiasm about technology and a passion to learn on the job
Honesty about your skills and knowledge
The ability to apply problem solving skills to technical issues
Good written and verbal communication skills
Good logical thinking and analytical approach to problem solving
Brownie points for any of the following: An Understanding of TDD; DevOps; Any contribution to open source projects

column2: Working at Makino is a rewarding experience. Makino is a Japanese Machine Tool MNC, known globally as a leader in metal cutting technologies. column2: Makino Asia developed into a fully integrated manufacturing company, incorporating Research and Development (R&D), engineering production and business administration under one roof.   • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Windows is a must along with extensive experience in software development and testing.

As a Software Engineer the broad area of your job responsibilities should cover the following:
Project Delivery
• Analyse process/program specifications & translate specifications to program codes, conforming to program guidelines and programming best practices
• Make changes to configurable items, which include hardware, software, documentation, etc. It covers configuration management planning, configuration identification, configuration controls & audits
• Develop unit test package, execute tests & document test results to ensure the quality of the program
• Assist in the integration testing, system testing, User Acceptance Test (UAT) & implementation activities to fix the reported problems/bugs of the system to ensure the smooth execution of programs in the production environment 
• Investigate all reported problems/errors & initiate amendments & testing so that the system can operate correctly & efficiently
• Prepare & maintain up-to-date system documentation.  
• Analyse functional requirements to translate into application design using established design methodologies and guidelines
• Ensure codes comply with company's security guidelines
Teamwork
• Work with team lead to ensure design and programme codes conform to architecture and design standards, and that design satisfies functional and system requirements
• Participate in requirements gathering; work with Business Analysts in reviewing and refining functional specifications
• Participate in peer reviews to improve project quality

As a Software Engineer, you will be working with a multidisciplinary team of software, computer, mechanical, electronics and communications engineers who are passionate in turning ideas to actual systems, with a strong sense of purpose in advancing our capabilities. Our Software Engineers shall develop software that breathes intelligence into our systems. We strive to make our systems smarter and easier to operate, collaborating seamlessly with other systems to meet the mission requirements.

You will be involved in one or more of the following activities in a software development life cycle:
  • Be part of a dynamic team to elicit system requirements and develop software specifications, based on mission and users' needs
  • Design software architecture that are resilient, safe and secured
  • Write robust code to implement software requirements and design tests cases
  • Build up test environment and simulators for hardware and software verifications
  • Collaborate with the team to carry out integration tests with the hardware platform in the lab / field / flight / sea trials
  • Short term travel overseas for trials may be required in certain job posts.
 Requirements:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer / Electrical / Electronic Engineering or Computer Science
  • Experience in C / C++ / Java / Python programming and Object-Oriented Analysis & Design would be advantageous
  • Passion to write code and participate in field trials to see the code in action
  • Interest in any of the following areas: Machine Learning, Data Analytics, IoT, Real-Time Embedded Systems, Cyber Physical System Security, Robotics, Graphical User Interfaces, Video Encoding, Signal Processing, Network Communications, Control, or full web stack development
  • Open minded and comfortable in interacting with engineers from other disciplines
  • Working Location: Jalan Boon Lay

Festo – a leading world-wide supplier of automation technology and the performance leader in industrial training and education programs

At Festo, the focus is on people. This is true of each and every one of our 20,120 employees worldwide in 250 locations. The result: the company provides 300,000 customers in 200 industry segments worldwide with pneumatic and electric drive technology for both factory and process automation as well as cutting-edge training solutions.

Festo offers a challenging environment, good career advancement and attractive remuneration package for the suitable candidate.
","

Reporting to the Factory Automation Design Manager, SEA you will be responsible for providing expert knowledge in the development of control system design, graphic user interface and software configuration/programming in all aspects of customer solution projects for Factory Automation System.

Primarily, you will be performing software architecture, configuration and programming development work for customised solutions in order to achieve customer requirements depending on any of the components/brands. You will also be providing sales support to SEA customers/colleagues for both, systems and components levels.

Other key responsibilities include:

  • Providing engineering and technical support to external customers, and internal customers (Festo Companies)
  • Taking action to resolve operational problems related to Factory Automation Projects and minimise delays/cost
  • Providing the control system overview, design solution and being involved in the presentation of the solution to the customer
  • Liaising with other local as well as regional and international operations departments
  • Coaching junior software engineers

Engineering and Project Execution includes:

  • Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, control flowcharts, layouts, electrical diagrams, Programming matrix, source code comments and clear code.
  • To develop programming follow sequence and control in different programming languages with different models/brands of components
  • To design and develop the graphic user interface for HMI
  • Experience in developing a workable, ease of operation, recoverable and robust control Source Code.
  • To configure and tune the controller following the design setup on different models/brands of controller
  • Creates production documentations including detailed electrical drawings, Part list, IO list, Testing/buy off criteria, costing and project documentation.
  • Creates project documentation including ISO Documents, system overview, Operation manual and etc.
  • Understand client’s requirements, identifying and addressing design parameters and engineering problems to ensure solutions are implemented.
  • Internal and external communication for design sequence control/approval.
  • Work independently on tasks assigned with minimum supervision.
  •  Program design follow timeline discussed/given by project manager on project schedule planning
  • Perform IO check, Dry/Wet run, troubleshooting & testing of the new machine.
  • Design cost monitoring with the expected quality within budget
  • Perform on-site testing and commissioning
  • Support production on series production projects on testing and troubleshooting.
  • Responsible for UL audit and maintaining the qualification of built.
  • Responsible for Transfer project setup and knowledge know-how. (if any)

Projects Completion

  • Maintains accurate records and files according to Festo ISO quality standard
  • System factory acceptance test with internal/external customers
  • Provide operation training.

Servicing

  • Commissioning of the Systems engineered by the Customer Solution team.
  • Support local on-site team on commissioning after hand-over (for simple system).
  • Performs other duties of a similar nature or level

What skills and experience do you need for this role?

  • A Bachelor Degree or Diploma in Electrical, Electronic or Mechatronic Engineering or equivalent
  • Proficient in MS Office
  • Proficient in Design Software - ePlan, Designer studio
  • Experienced with Programming Software – CoDeSys, FAS, TwinCAT, Studio 5000 Logix designer, Simatic S7/TIA Portal, etc
  • Programming language – Visual Basic, C++, Ladder, structured text, sequential flowchart 
  • Relevant experience in Factory Automation
  • Fluent in business English

column3: Creative is the worldwide leader in digital entertainment products. Founded in Singapore in 1981, Creative started with the vision that multimedia would revolutionise the way people interact with their PCs.

Famous for its Sound Blaster sound cards and for launching the multimedia revolution, Creative is now driving digital entertainment with cutting-edge audio solutions, premium wireless speakers, high performance earphone products and web cameras. The company's innovative hardware, proprietary technology, applications and services enable consumers to experience high-quality digital entertainment - anytime, anywhere.

Since launching the phenomenally successful Sound Blaster sound cards and setting the de-facto standard for PC audio in 1989, Creative has been able to leverage on its leading-edge audio technology, a huge user base of more than 400 million, and strong brand name to expand into the exciting lifestyle Personal Digital Entertainment (PDE) market.

Creative is now well recognised as a global leader for product innovation in the audio and PDE segments, offering consumers a complete, high quality digital entertainment experience through Creative's hardware, software applications and services. Finding the perfect balance between form and function, Creative strives for every product to be a sensory feast for the eyes and ears.

Today, Creative is spearheading multiple product categories with its multiple award-winning solutions, including the highly-acclaimed Super X-Fi headphone holography series and Sound Blaster hi-resolution multichannel USB DAC and internal Sound Cards.

Creative's mission is to expand its leadership role in the lifestyle Entertainment market, using groundbreaking technology and leading-edge designs for not just the technically-savvy consumers, but for everyone who enjoys entertainment, with strong focus on user-friendly interface, multiple features and established industrial designs.

column2: Creative's global corporate headquarters is located in Singapore, in the heart of the Asia-Pacific region. It has regional business units in the United States, Europe and Asia.

column3: Creative is a public listed company on the main board of the Singapore Exchange (SGX) since June 1994.

column1:
","
As part of Creative's focus on innovation and excellence, the Creative R&D team based in Singapore is expanding to meet the challenges posed by the rapidly changing world of consumer audio products.
The team works closely with colleagues based in Singapore, UK and US on embedded software for audio products.
We are looking for professional Embedded Software Engineers to execute complete embedded software development lifecycle.
Responsibilities
  • Design and implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment
  • Identify technical challenges and risks and accordingly develop resolutions

  • Design, develop, code, test and debug system software

  • Follow coding practices and recommend process improvements to build efficient systems
  • Interface with hardware design and development
  • Support software QA
  • Provide post production support
Requirements
  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science and Electronics Engineering or its equivalent
  • Strong C/C++ programming skills
  • Experience with ARM-based processors
  • Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing Techniques
  • Experience with Agile software development methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban
  • Experience with version control systems such as Subversion and Git
  • Experience in firmware systems design, embedded development in Linux, Android BSP development, Real-time operating systems, Bluetooth and Wifi stack is an added advantage
  • An interest in speech, audio sound design and/or music and consumer audio is desirable
  • Those with 3 or more years of relevant experience may be considered for senior position

column1: <div>

From its inception in 2000, CentiForce has embarked on a journey to excellence.

CentiForce is in the business of providing integrated solutions in the field of Reliability Testing and, Inspection and Measurement to various industries; mainly in Semiconductor, Electronics, Automotive, Aerospace and Pharmaceutical.

In 2002, CentiForce established its first testing laboratory and in 2004, we were awarded the ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation for our Calibration and Testing Laboratory services from Singapore Accreditation Council.

Building upon the solid foundation we have laid down, we will continue to develop exciting and innovative Reliability Testing and, Test and Measurement instruments; broadening and deepening our extensive leadership in the field.

Our esteemed client is looking for a Software Testing Engineer who will be responsible for the following primary functions:

We are looking to for a talented Unity Developer to join our design team. As a Unity Developer, you will be responsible for planning and implementing simulations, XR functionality, building efficient and reliable code, and ensuring the quality and craftmanship of the finished product.

To ensure success as a Unity Developer, you should have extensive experience working with Unity3D XR pipeline, excellent coding skills, 3D knowledge for XR and a good eye for detail. A top-class Unity Developer can visualize, design, and code that speak directly to the target market.

Unity Developer duties and responsibilities

  • Lead the design and planning of technical architecture for multiple solutions
  • Transform design specification into functional demos
  • Communicate with other team members
  • Establish effective strategy and development pipeline
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
  • Ensure the best performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Identify process and application bottlenecks and bugs
  • Offer and implement solutions, innovate and prototyping

Unity Developer requirements and qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Game Design or related field
  • 3-5 years of work experience as Unity Developer
  • 3-5 years of experience with game physics and simulation
  • Experience in developing AR/VR for various platforms
  • Good knowledge of an object-oriented programming language, preferably C#
  • Ability to work in Agile environment with high iterative processes
  • Experience with scripting, textures, animation, GUI styles, user session management, optimizing memory, middleware and building simulation engines
  • Able to work with APIs and middleware integrations
  • Worked and shipped product using Oculus/HoloLens or any other XR headsets
  • Experience in implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
  • Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
  • Good time-management skills
  • Familiar with Agile management
  • Able to guide and mentor the team

Job Description

ST Engineering Geo-Insights Pte Ltd is a data analytics company focused on generating insights from geospatial data and remotely sensed data. We are looking for potential team members who are keen and passionate about implementing technological solutions to solve real-world problems. Besides the joy of seeing your work delivering value to global technological advancement, there are opportunities to publish research on top research platforms. You can look forward to a growth-oriented career in a supportive and fast-paced environment.

Job Responsibilities

The software engineer role covers a wide range of design, development, and testing activities for Geo-Insights' cloud-based imagery delivery and analytics platform for our consumers. We work collaboratively with other teams to launch new features and scale our infrastructure to ensure the platform runs optimally for the needs of our customers.

  • Design and maintain the overall architecture of the cloud platform in AWS
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues within the software delivery pipeline stages
  • Design and develop new platform features UI/UX in a disciplined and sustainable way
  • Implement high-quality and maintainable production code using relevant design patterns

Job Requirements:

  • Masters / Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • At least 5 years of relevant work experience in software development
  • Proficient in NodeJS, Python, TypeScript programming
  • Proficient in frontend frameworks - e.g. React, Angular, Bootstrap, etc.
  • Proficient in developing backend services using Restful APIs
  • Familiarity with any RDBMS or Non-SQL DB - e.g. MySQL, PostgresSQL, MongoDB
  • Experience with AWS cloud deployment and Git
  • Motivated and proactive, able to work as a team, and results oriented
  • Location: Ang Mo Kio
  • Singaporean only

We are looking for a passionate, self driven, fully hands on front-end/ full-stack engineer to work with our IIoT wireless team. About ComfortDelGro
We are one of the largest land transport companies in the world with a global workforce, a global shareholder base and a global outlook. We operate in seven countries and has a global fleet of about 40,000 vehicles.ComfortDelGro’s businesses include bus, taxi, rail, car rental and leasing, automotive engineering services, inspection and testing services, driving centres, non-emergency patient transport services, insurance broking services and outdoor advertising.
Apart from being the market leader in Singapore, ComfortDelGro has a significant overseas presence. The Group’s operations currently extend from the United Kingdom and Ireland to Australia, Vietnam, Malaysia, New Zealand and across nine cities in China, including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenyang and Chengdu.

106,software,/en/job/software-developer-future-health-technologies-9397972,9397972,Software Developer - Future Health Technologies,False,False,4000,8000,SGD,ETH Singapore SEC Limited,23-Mar-22,False,,,201016935D,,,51 - 200 Employees,,CREATE Tower,"

 The Singapore-​ETH Centre (SEC) was established by one of the world’s leading universities - ETH Zurich (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich) and the National Research Foundation Singapore in 2010.

The centre provides a multicultural and interdisciplinary environment to researchers working on diverse themes focussed on sustainable and liveable cities, resilient urban systems, and patient-​centric healthcare. The centre is home to a community of over 100 doctoral, postdoctoral and professorial researchers working in three main programmes - Future Cities Lab Global, Future Resilient Systems, and Future Health Technologies – and a range of related research projects.

As part of the National Research Foundation's CREATE campus (Campus for Research Excellence and Technological Enterprise), members of the SEC also benefit from opportunities to engage with colleagues from top universities based in the campus.

","

Future Health Technologies – Brain -Computer Interface Driven Therapy

Introduction

ETH Zurich is one of the leading universities of the world with a strong focus on science and engineering. In 2010 it established the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) in collaboration with the National Research Foundation (NRF) to do interdisciplinary research on pressing problems.

In collaboration with the National University of Singapore (NUS), the Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Duke - NUS, the National Health Group (NHG), National University Health System (NUHS), and SingHealth, SEC is undertaking a research programme on ""Future Health Technologies (FHT)"". It addresses some immanent health challenges by developing a future-oriented Mobile Digital Health Concept that tackles the increase in patients suffering from chronic diseases such as stroke, as a consequence of a rapidly ageing population with mobile digital technologies, covering the value chain from acute care to patient's private homes.

Project background

Our project within FHT aims to develop and investigate human-machine interfaces that promote sensorimotor recovery in patients with stroke. We will be collecting health-related data at the hospital and participant’s home and delivering digital health solutions using mobile apps (e.g. gamified rehabilitation protocols) and therapy devices (e.g., for neurorehabilitation of upper limb sensorimotor impairments). To develop a technology platform for testing therapy protocols/programme and data collection pipelines with portability and simplicity, we are looking for an experienced Software Developer to work with an international team of researchers and technicians from SEC, ETH Zurich and local partners in Singapore, including the Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH).

Within this framework the SEC has the following job opening (workplace is Singapore):

Key responsibilities

As a Software Developer/Senior in the FHT, you will be responsible to

- Research, design, implement, test and manage software for the brain-computer interface driven therapy project.

- Deliver technical project management for FHT research activities at SEC including project planning activities, engineering requirements, effort estimates, on-site and remote exchange with several research partners.

- Develop secure mobile apps for data collection and mobile health interventions including interfaces to endpoints such as sensors as well as secure transfer to the FHT server infrastructure.

- Enable data exchange between multiple rehabilitation technologies and develop graphical user interfaces that can display these data in an intelligent manner to clinical personnel and patients

- Deploy and improve the existing mobile rehabilitation platform at the SEC and offer technical support to ongoing studies.

- Interact with FHT System Engineer(s), Scientific IT Services at ETH Zurich, FHT management, security/privacy specialists, and end users/researchers

Requirements

This position requires a university or applied science degree in Computer Science, informatics, software engineering or a related field/equivalent work experience. You have solid programming skills in C# and experience with Unity. Ideally, you also have experience with databases and working on a large codebase with multiple collaborators. You are interested in open source projects, user interface design, mobile app development incl. management of the app submission process, data management, continuous integration, privacy enhancing technologies and development. You can present technical complex aspects in a concise and easy to understand way. You are looking for a sustainable and meaningful job to support healthcare systems, healthcare workers and individuals in need, i.e. to use rehabilitation technologies to improve neurorehabilitation outcomes in persons with a stroke. You are proactive, communicative and you show personal responsibility, initiative and enjoy technology and interdisciplinary teamwork. You can work autonomously and with a self-starter attitude. Good communication skills orally and in writing are a plus for working in a multicultural environment. Previous experience with health-related data is a plus.

We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents:

A comprehensive CV, cover letter, educational certificates, work testimonial, and contact information of at least two references upon request.

Work location: 1 Create Way, CREATE Tower, Singapore 138602 (NUS University Town)

Further information about the project can be found on our website:

- About FHT, please visit https://fht.ethz.ch/

Remuneration will be offered based on educational qualification and work experience.

The Singapore-ETH-Centre is an equal opportunity and family-friendly employer. All candidates will be evaluated on their merits and qualifications, without regards to gender, race, age or religion.

This Software engineer is part of the Solution Engineering team that resides in Singapore, he/she is particularly focusing on supply chain tools, data analytics and dashboard development until deployment to turn data into information followed by the insight that drives business decisions. The Solution Engineering team works on various hardware and software automation projects along with production/supply chain efficiency projects. Strong project management skill, interpersonal/communication skill, supply chain experience/knowledge, data science, statistic and programming is preferable.
Responsibilities:
  • Lead and collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, business users, project managers, IT and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions.
  • Analyze complex patterns or trends, interpret operational needs, and develop creative & innovative solutions involving data model design/ reporting assembly/ application structure using statistical technique.
  • Develop and implement software on premise and cloud for data collection, data analytics, graphical user interfaces or data lake to optimize supply chain, planning and production operation efficiency.
  • Work closely with software, test, mechanical and electrical engineer to design and develop production/manufacturing software, automation development to work with Agilent Products (i.e. software libraries, parametric test data analysis/mining or dashboarding tool or data visualization, robotic automation and RPA)
  • Collaborate with validation engineer on computerized system validation for ISO9001 and ISO13485 compliance.
  • Stay up to date on latest industrial technology trend, leverage, and integration into the design and solutioning lifecycle
  • Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms.
  • Conduct solution training, handle technical enquiries and provide recommendations for continuous improvement.
Qualifications:
The candidate must have a Bachelors or Masters's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering with a minimum of 5+ years relevant experience in software development, data analytics and supply chain.
Candidates with other Engineering qualifications with proven track records in Software/computer engineering skills in the supply chain field are encouraged to apply.
Requirements:
  • Proven advanced verbal and written communication skills in communicating needs, plans and achievements to people at all levels.
  • Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision
  • Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with modern programming languages such as C#, JavaScript and Python.
  • Experience in defect tracking JIRA and BitBucket version control.
  • Hands-on in DevOps, building and deploying infrastructure with cloud technologies such as AWS.
  • Strong in backend development and ETL frameworks such as SQL and SSIS.
  • Strong in building APIs and services using RESTful.
  • Strong in robotic process automation using Microsoft power platform.
  • Strong analytic skills in data collection, data cleaning, organizing, analysis and reasoning to disseminate enormous information in detail.
  • Experience in test and measurement development is a plus.

column2:
Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s 81,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries.  With annual revenue over $19 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. ","
CAREER DEVELOPMENT

We attract and retain candidates that enjoy working on complex Software Engineering challenges, seeing their work used by many clients, and being part of our Product development over the longer term.
We offer a range of techniques to help our engineers grow and develop:
Our Darwin Growth Framework helps individuals identify strengths and areas of development independent of the role they are performing.
Our on-demand technical training platform is brilliant for individual learning needs
Our culture of growth and learning is integrated into how we work. A code-review for example would be a positive opportunity to question, discuss and reflect on appropriate solutions
We have many examples of people joining at Grad level and progressing right through to Enterprise Architecture.  Alternative paths include, Delivery, Release, Quality Assurance (Engineer in Test), Product management and much, much more.
In order to support our team and strengthen the growth of our global business, we are looking for a:
Graduate Software Engineer, DARWIN
Join us on our journey and take the next step in your career with the Software Engineering team.

What can you expect?
Every member of the Software Engineering department is responsible for:
The availability, security, scalability of our Darwin platform.
Delivering our product roadmap.
Planning for the future.
Generating enthusiasm and a sense of both technical and product pride.
What is in it for you?
Comprehensive employee benefits and insurance coverage
We strive to make Mercer the employer of choice for the best and brightest diverse talent, fostering an inclusive work environment where employees from varied backgrounds, cultures and ethnicities can thrive.
We will count on you to:
Be passionate and enthusiastic about software engineering.
Track the progress that you are making towards the wider goals of your team, and transparently communicate that progress to your team and Technical Lead.
Keep to the processes, standards and designs your team has agreed.
Ensure you and others continuously improve, by proposing and implementing new processes, designs and engineering practices that make the team more effective.
Contribute to the definition of product features, getting involved in workshops with other engineering teams and Product Management.
Take responsibility for supporting your changes all the way through to proving that they work well – and continue to work well – in production.
What you need to have:
Graduate degree in Computing
A good understanding of an object-oriented programming language, Agile development methodologies and continuous delivery
Strong technical/programming ability, ideally familiar with Microsoft technologies.
A desire to learn C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, WCF, MVC, jQuery, TDD
Enthusiasm about technology and a passion to learn on the job
Honesty about your skills and knowledge
The ability to apply problem solving skills to technical issues
Good written and verbal communication skills
Good logical thinking and analytical approach to problem solving
Brownie points for any of the following: - An Understanding of TDD; - DevOps; - Any contribution to open source projects

Design and develop software applications for airport logistics systems such as baggage handling systems, air cargo handling systems, in-flights catering systems and parcel sortation systems. The computer software engineer shall perform the following functions:

  • Requirement analysis. 
  • Functional specification documentation.
  • Software design and development.
  • Software implementation.
  • Testing and commissioning.
  • Provide end-user training and pre and after-sales support.

Job Requirements:

  • Master/Bachelor Degree in Automation/ Computer Engineering /Computer Science.
  • Able to design and debug system/platform level software independently.
  • Strong knowledge at least in two of the following programming knowledge
  • C#, C/C++, VB
  • DBMS, MS SQL, Oracle, MySQL
  • DirectX, VB.NET/ASP.NET;
  • Strong knowledge in software engineering is a MUST.
  • 2 years’ experience of software development in doing full SDLC is advantageous.
  • Project experience in Microsoft SQL Server, Visual Studio C#, .Net, WCF, WPF.
  • Experience in development with Version Control software, such as Git or SVN.
  • Knowledge about software design pattern and relevant practice experience.
  • Knowledge at integration of Intranet in an enterprise, database and network security.
  • Experience or knowledge of Computer Vision will be a high advantage.
  • Applicants MUST be able to work independently within a team and be technology-driven
  • Applicants MUST be willing to travel and work in Singapore and on overseas projects.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Information Technology and Services","
As a Senior Software Engineer, the broad area of your job responsibilities should cover the following:
Project Delivery
• Analyse process/program specifications & translate specifications to program codes, conforming to program guidelines and programming best practices
• Make changes to configurable items, which include hardware, software, documentation, etc. It covers configuration management planning, configuration identification, configuration controls & audits
• Develop unit test package, execute tests & document test results to ensure the quality of the program
• Assist in the integration testing, system testing, User Acceptance Test (UAT) & implementation activities to fix the reported problems/bugs of the system to ensure the smooth execution of programs in the production environment 
• Investigate all reported problems/errors & initiate amendments & testing so that the system can operate correctly & efficiently
• Prepare & maintain up-to-date system documentation.  
• Analyse functional requirements to translate into application design using established design methodologies and guidelines
• Ensure codes comply with company's security guidelines
Teamwork
• Work with team lead to ensure design and programme codes conform to architecture and design standards, and that design satisfies functional and system requirements
• Participate in requirements gathering; work with Business Analysts in reviewing and refining functional specifications
• Participate in peer reviews to improve project quality
The ideal candidate should have/possess the following:

• 4 -7 years of working experience in developing and delivering application software
• Possess relevant system development / maintenance experience using Java-related technologies
• Possess knowledge of PEGA project development will be advantageous
• Experience in Agile development and Certified Scrum developer will be advantageous
• Possess initiative and disposition with a strong commitment and orientation towards results and high-quality standards
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think out of the box
• Team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Self-motivator with a positive attitude and with high energy
• Customer focused
• Proficient in written and spoken English
• Diploma / Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Information Technology related field, or IT equivalent
  • Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent.
  • At least 4 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
  • Preferably Senior Executives specializing in IT/Computer - Software or equivalent.
  • 2 Full-Time and Contract position(s) available.

Xiaomi Corporation, registered in Asia as Xiaomi Inc., is a Chinese designer and manufacturer of consumer electronics and related software, home appliances, and household items. Behind Samsung, it is the second largest manufacturer of smartphones, all of which run the MIUI operating system, a fork of Android. In 2020, the company sold 146.3 million smartphones and, as of August 2021, its MIUI operating system had over 450 million monthly active users. It also is a major manufacturer of appliances including televisions, flashlights, unmanned aerial vehicles, and air purifiers using its Internet of Things and Xiaomi Smart Home product ecosystems. The name ""Xiaomi"" literally means millet and rice, and is based on the Buddhist concept of starting from the bottom before aiming for the top.

","

Job Description:

1. Build platform services and tools to support efficient training & serving of machine learning models.

2. Improve system scalability and efficiency through continuous evaluation, analysis, and refinement of the system implementation.

3. Implement scalable and fault-tolerant cloud-native systems, write micro-services for orchestrating for machine learning workloads leveraging container and Kubernetes technologies.

Job Requirement：

﻿1. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.

2. A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in algorithms, data structures, objects-oriented programming, design patterns, multi-threaded programming, and software design principles.

3. Experience with cloud-based application development using Docker and Kubernetes, and experience in building, deploying & managing CI/CD pipelines.

4. Hands-On experience with version control tools such as Github, Bitbucket and Experience in RESTful implementation, micro-service architectures, and container patterns.

5. In-Depth understanding of System Design & Software Architecture.

6. Excellent written and communication skills in English language.

Good to have:

1. Knowledge of Machine Learning fundamentals.

2. An understanding of how to apply Machine Learning libraries to Train and Serve a ML Model.

About ComfortDelGro
We are one of the largest land transport companies in the world with a global workforce, a global shareholder base and a global outlook. We operate in seven countries and has a global fleet of about 40,000 vehicles.
ComfortDelGro’s businesses include bus, taxi, rail, car rental and leasing, automotive engineering services, inspection and testing services, driving centres, non-emergency patient transport services, insurance broking services and outdoor advertising.
Apart from being the market leader in Singapore, ComfortDelGro has a significant overseas presence. The Group’s operations currently extend from the United Kingdom and Ireland to Australia, Vietnam, Malaysia, New Zealand and across nine cities in China, including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenyang and Chengdu.
Who are We
ComfortDelGro Bus Pte Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of ComfortDelGro Corporation Limited, which is one of the largest land transport companies in the world with a global workforce, a global shareholder base and a global outlook. The ComfortDelgro Private Bus (CDGB) business is pivoting and transforming to a digital platform company and is on a talent hunt for passionate and experienced Technology professionals to be part of this digital transformation.
About the Role
We are looking for a Software Engineer to be part of the team that is developing a modern cloud-based transport services platform that connects our passengers, drivers, clients and service providers together.
Responsibilities:
  • To work closely together with the Product Manager; in providing technical advice and solutions to deliver the desired business outcomes.
  • Participate in the full Agile development process with requirements analysis, application design, development, implementation and features release.
  • Rapid prototyping and code review.
  • Conduct user training on application systems and provide on-going production support.
  • Manage change requests and provide quick and efficient solutions.
  • Maintain system procedure and documentation according to established standards.
Requirements:
  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • At least 3 years of working experience in design and development of application product/system
  • Good understanding of software engineering best practices and experience in Agile methodology
  • Strong programming skills in C# with .NET / .NET Core with experience in React.js and SQL
  • Experience in cloud technology, Map SDK/API or transportation domain is an added advantage
  • Good analysis and problem-solving skills, attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal communication skills

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

141,software,/en/job/software-development-team-lead-w-13-month-performance-bonus-9313716,9313716,Software Development Team Lead (w/ 13 Month + Performance Bonus),False,False,5000,6000,SGD,SGCM Pte Ltd (sgCarMart.com),10 hours ago,False,,,200722249K,,,51 - 200 Employees,,Automobile Megamart,"

sgCarMart is Singapore’s most popular car buying and selling website with over 10,000 car listings. It offers the largest database of new and used cars for sale with at least 10 cars sold every hour and helps account for approximately 70% of all second-hand car transactions in Singapore. The site reaches 4.2M users monthly, making it the top ranked automotive website with more than 80 times the engagement compared to its competitors. It also has a large automotive following across social platforms in Singapore with more than 120,000 highly engaged followers across Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

sgCarMart is Southeast Asia’s most profitable car site with a blended penetration rate of 60% in the customer segments it serves. The award-winning company is a subsidiary of the Toyota Group.

","

About sgCarMart

sgCarMart is an established automotive media company in Singapore. Our site reaches 2.6M visitors monthly, making it the top-ranked local automotive website

We are on the lookout for talented individuals to join our growing team!

The Software Development Team Lead Role:

We are looking for an experienced Team Lead in Software Development to oversee and direct the day-to-day IT operations and to lead, manage and coach a team of five web developers. You will be involved in the planning and implementation of web-based projects, delegate tasks and duties within the IT department, and ensure that deliverables are met on time. As the IT Team Lead, you will work closely with the IT Manager in handling the technical development of our websites and applications – including identifying problematic areas and proposing strategic solutions to improve and update our systems.

The IT Team is the backbone of our company and your contributions will ensure that the team can run more effectively and efficiently to drive our digital platforms forward.

The ideal candidate should have a solid background in software development and web technologies, and at least 3 years of experience as a scrum master or in a project management setting.

Key Responsibilities:

· Lead and manage a team of five software developers: provide mentoring, technical guidance, feedback, and training to team members

· Plan and implement projects, align project objectives with the company goals, and make sure the team is clear on the objectives

· Monitor project progress: Define tasks and allocate resources, create schedules, project timelines, track deliverables and ensure quality control

· Improve our overall website development methodology: gather requirements, timeline projection, implementation, testing, and deployment

· Understand and contribute to technical solutions from design through coding

· Work with the team to fix website vulnerabilities

· Keep track of emerging technologies and industry trends

Requirements and Technical Know-How:

· Diploma or above in IT / Computer Science / Software Engineering or relevant discipline

· Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience as a scrum master or in similar project management setting

· Extensive technical background and hands-on experience in software development and web technologies

· Proficient in using PHP, HTML, CSS, JAVASCRIPT, MYSQL

· Good knowledge in best practices for project management, business applications, websites, and mobile apps development

· Good understanding and hands-on experience with system quality, security, performance, maintainability & extensibility

Soft Skills:

· Strong leadership and people skills – able to coach a small team effectively, motivate the team, and provide regular feedback

· Strong organisational skills and meticulous

· Good time management – able to work under pressure and within tight deadlines

Salary:

· Depending on your qualification, you can expect a basic salary of $5,000 to $6,000, plus 13th Month and Performance Bonus

To Apply:

If you like what you've read so far, please submit your resume and expected salary via the ‘Apply’ button. Let's talk!

Why join sgCarMart!?

· We’re Singapore’s No.1 car portal for new cars and used cars

· 13th Month + Performance Bonus

· Medical Claim Benefits

· 5 Day Work Week (9 am to 6 pm)

· Positive workplace culture

· Quarterly team bonding activities

· Annual overseas company trip

Work Culture in sgCarMart:

We’re a relatively young company with a positive work culture. People are friendly and willing to guide new joiners. Most importantly, we understand the need to take creative breaks hence we have a relatively well-stocked pantry with some (unhealthy) snacks, so at your own risk! You can also expect regular team bonding activities, company dinners, fortnightly Friday treats where we feast on sinful desserts, and annual overseas company trips (post-pandemic of course), We also get the occasional durian party as well depending on the mood of our bosses. I think you get the idea that at sgCarMart, we love food as much as we love our cars!

column7: M1, a subsidiary of Keppel Corporation, is Singapore’s first digital network operator, providing a suite of communications services, including mobile, fixed line and fibre offerings, to over two million customers. Since the launch of commercial services in 1997, we have achieved many firsts – becoming one of the first operators to be awarded one of Singapore’s two nationwide 5G standalone network license, first operator to offer nationwide 4G service, as well as ultra high-speed fixed broadband, fixed voice and other services on the Next Generation Nationwide Broadband Network (NGNBN).

We offer a wide range of mobile and fixed communication services to our consumers, and deliver an extensive suite of services and solutions to our corporate customers which includes symmetrical connectivity solutions of up to 10Gbps, managed services, cloud solutions, cybersecurity solutions, Internet of Things and data centre services.

We collaborate closely with our shareholders Keppel Corporation and Singapore Press Holdings Limited to achieve operational synergies that strengthen our position as an established communications provider in the market.
Our mission is to drive transformation and evolution in Singapore’s telecommunications landscape through cutting-edge technology and made-to-measure offerings.

As a Lead/Senior System Analyst, you will work with the team to support cloud-native, real-time Online Charging System (OCS) with extensive rating capabilities. You must be able to adapt in agile and dynamic working environment with little supervision.
Job Responsibilities
  • Obtain and maintain an in-depth knowledge of current OCS software
  • Participate in discovery sessions with Product owner to gather and analyze business requirement for OCS.
  • Configure new rate/new charging principle in OCS based on Product Owner (PO) requirement
  • Design/execute/verify Charging Record for various UAT scenarios with Finance User, ensure charging accuracy.
  • Liaise with software partners, users, team members and other IT personnel for any enquiries or for problem resolution.
  • Ensure undertaken tasks or projects implement and adhere to IT policies, standards and industry best practices
Requirements
  • Degree in Computer Science
  • Working experience in Telco industry or telecom project preferred, with in-depth knowledge of OCS embedded within 3GPP policy and charging control architecture.
  • 6 years of relevant working experience in Information Technology or related discipline
  • Highly energetic, motivated team player, able to work under tight timelines and pressure to participate in digital transformation journey
  • Have experience in solving complex technical challenges within an Agile team environment.
  • Hands-on experience in performing application testing, with automation tools.
  • Organised, meticulous, and able to work independently

  • Experience in using the Atlassian toolset (JIRA, Confluence)
  • Experience in other software:
    • Modern programming languages like Java, Python, etc.
    • In API development using REST, SOAP, etc.

As a Software Engineer of the medical product design and development team, you will work directly with Principal Engineer, cross functional project team members to deliver technical solutions for the product.

Client Details

One of our top client, founded in 1999 and established technology excellent center to focus on the R&D surgical robotics. Aim to work with the best and innovative technologies in Singapore.

Description

As a Software Engineer, you will:

  • Work with cross functional team on detailed application software programming and test plan at product level, sub-systems, modules and components level
  • Support and review critical technical development related to application software
  • Perform feasibility study on conceptual design for new products
  • Resolve issues and improve product performance/functionalities with software upgrades
  • Ensure the software functions meet user needs, and smooth transition from prototype phase to release phase
  • Perform analytical studies, risk assessment, software verification and validation on the product
  • Oversee and co-ordinate software development and integration locally or with overseas partners
  • Ensure proper documentation (design history file) and communication with internal and external suppliers, in compliance with quality management system and regulatory standards requirements

Profile

As a Qualified candidate, you shall possess:

  • Bachelor's degree in software engineering, or computer sciences.
  • Minimum 3 years' experience in application software design and development, producing prototype and production grade software
  • Strong technical ability in developing functions for image processing, image transformation and 2D/3D visualization and modelling
  • Proficient in MS Visual C++, Linux, Python programming language to develop real-time control algorithms for the electro-mechanical product
  • Familiar with toolkits for 2D/3D visualization and graphical user interface, such as QT, VTK. Able to integrate the toolkit functions into main application software.
  • Familiar with a variety of hardware-software communication methods (serial, CAN, I2C etc) for sensor, actuator, motor and controller
  • Familiar with Cybersecurity measures for network and database security
  • An analytical problem solver to identify root cause, devise/evaluate/recommend optimal solutions to prevent future issues
  • Natural ability to communicate technical information, and build interpersonal relation with the team members
  • Able to work independently, self-motivated and organized with good teamwork skills

Job Offer

  • Permanent position with good salary package
  • Good career in an advanced market

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Wilson Tay on +65 6416 9838

Be part of a team responsible for software development in real-time embedded environment:
  • Performs software development and verification, and ensure the implementation and completion of the system requirements, aligned with the given timelines. Works with interdisciplinary teams to achieve the project goals.
  • Perform extensive software and system testing in customer’s location for a duration of time.
  • Ensures that the requirements are implemented accurately, following given coding rules and guidelines.
  • Ensure product quality with accurate unit-tests and realization within the given product architecture and coding standard.
  • Builds and maintains appropriate user documentation for the implementation. Comply and enforce to the company software Quality Management System and Safety requirements
Requirements:
  • Master's or Bachelor’s degree in software engineering, computer science\engineering, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
  • Strong programming skills in C, C++, C#, .NET architecture and MS Visual Studio.
  • At least 2 years of software development experience with emphasis on software testing will be an added advantage.
  • Knowledge of software development lifecycle processes, methodologies, and software test methodologies.
The following skills are optional and would be an added advantage
  • Software development experience in RTOS (Real Time Operating System) and embedded environment
  • Working experience in Avionics and Aviation-related domains

column2: OmniVision has been committed to developing the most advanced CMOS image sensors and complete camera solutions. To achieve this mission, we continually search for talented individuals who work well in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. This is how OmniVision has rapidly become one of the world's leading suppliers of CMOS image sensors to the global electronics industry, serving the world’s top digital camera and handset makers.

OmniVision is a unique workplace because it has the energy and excitement of a startup, while offering the stability and opportunities of an established company as we are today. In its 17 years of existence, the Company has seen dynamic growth, going from technology startup to the world’s largest CMOS image sensor supplier. Since inception, OmniVision has shipped more than four billion CameraChip™ image sensors.

By constantly adding new talent to our highly experienced teams of engineers, OmniVision continues to invest in its future, which reaches well beyond today’s popular camera applications such as camera phones and webcams. OmniVisions ability to set imaging trends today while also developing brand new applications and markets for tomorrow has enabled us to stay on top. Our CameraChip image sensors not only take your family pictures, they also advance diagnostic medicine and improve driver and passenger safety in cars. The possibilities for imaging are endless. Bring your ideas, expertise and enthusiasm to OmniVision and work with our talented engineering teams to define the future of digital imaging.

Position Overview:

We are looking for self-motivated and self-starting engineers to join our team to design, implement, integrate, test, qualify and maintain embedded software for edge AI systems.

For this role, the scope is biased towards verification and validation at unit, component and system level;

* take in SRS/FRD and translate it into a corresponding test plan.

* put in place suitable test strategy.

* design and implement test cases.

* execute and report on the test results.

* work with unit developers on improvement in coding techniques, design patterns, test assertion, etc.

* work with the entire team on continuous improvement of the quality of our deliverables.

To excel, you need to have a good grasp of test effectiveness and test efficiency;

* an eye for details; appreciation of Murphy's Law and identify test (failure) corners in a systematic manner, aside from normal operating conditions.

* solid practitioner of test automation.

This position is not entirely about embedded software testing though; you will also contribute in unit design and implement per project's need.

Responsibilities:

1. Responsible for verification and validation at unit, component and system level.

2. Responsible for test plan, design, implementation, execution and reporting.

3. Support team in matters relating to CI/CD.

4. Support team in unit design and implementation.

5. Plan and coordinate projects with teams globally and execute independently.

Requirements:

Candidate qualifications include:

* Excellent coding skills with C and/or C++ is a given.

* Good understanding of various test coverage metrics.

* Good experience with Bash and/or Python for automation purpose.

* Experience with source code management (GIT, SVN).

* Experience with any RTOS.

* Knowledge of test management system (e.g. TestRail) is a plus.

* Knowledge of testing framework like Unity and CMocka is a plus.

* Knowledge of Confluence/JIRA is a plus.

* Knowledge of GitLab CI/CD is a plus.

* Knowledge of ASPICE compliance workflow is a plus.

* Knowledge of ML at the compute level is a plus.

Promising fresh from EE/CE are welcomed to apply; suitable mentoring and coaching will be provided to kick start your career in embedded software engineering with a focus on edge AI deployment.

Shopee is the leading e-commerce platform in Southeast Asia and Taiwan. It is a platform tailored for the region, providing customers with an easy, secure and fast online shopping experience through strong payment and logistical support.

Shopee aims to continually enhance its platform and become the region’s e-commerce destination of choice via ongoing product optimisation and localised user-centered strategies. Shopee, a Sea company, was first launched in Singapore in 2015, and has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, Indonesia, Vietnam and the Philippines. Sea is a leader in digital entertainment, e-commerce and digital financial services across Greater Southeast Asia. Sea's mission is to better the lives of consumers and small businesses with technology, and is listed on the NYSE under the symbol SE. The Shopee team comprises over 8,000 employees from across the region, and with our rapid expansion, we are constantly on the lookout for potential talents who have the passion and drive to become part of a fast-moving and dynamic team.","

Business Introduction

Digital Bank relies on data and technology to drive business operations and to achieve the integration of finance and technology. We will apply cloud computing, big data, artificial intelligence, and other Internet technologies to focus on the innovation in service models, customer experience, and risk control. We aim to provide differentiated, distinctive, high-quality and convenient financial services such as loans and deposits for our users.

  • Related domain experience in the Fin-Tech is strongly preferred

150,software,/en/job/software-engineer-flutter-9353305,9353305,"Software Engineer, Flutter",False,False,,,SGD,Carro Singapore,21-Mar-22,False,,9 days,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.
